About Us

MicroRunQC

MicroRunQC is a workflow in GalaxyTrakr that takes raw fastq files, runs the tools Trimmomatic and microrunqc, and concatenates and filters the resulting output into collections of draft de novo assemblies, quality assessments, and sequencing types. The latter are contained in tabular data files for download. The public GenomeTrakr protocol linked below in the References section covers use of the Workflow in detail. For assistance with how to import workflows in GalaxyTrakr, which is a bit less straightforward than using a single tool, please visit this tutorial.

Inputs: fastq files in a collection. For more information on how to create a collection, see this tutorial.

Outputs:

  • A tabular data file containing the file name, QC data, and MLST scheme and alleles for each sequence input.
  • Tabular data files containing the above data for each input sequence individually.
  • Fasta assembly files for each sequence input. This output can be used as input for further analysis tools, such as SeqSero2 for Salmonella sequences.

Documentation for Skesa can be found in GenomeTrakr's protocols.io resources.


This is where the video tutorial will live.


txt file containing the list of SRR accessions for the 10 sequences from the GenomeTrakr Validation Strain Set used in the video tutorial.

See this tutorial on importing sequencing files from NCBI, particularly the section on using a txt file to do so, if you need assistance with how to use this file.

After running MicroRunQC on the files acquired this way, your output file will look like this.
